titleInfo.title: Heart Surgery at National Jewish Hospital

physicalDescription.extent: 2 item (photograph), 8 x 10 inches, black and white
physicalDescription.note: Handwritten on envelope: ''#174 National Jewish Hospital''. On back of photograph: ''#174 1961 Heart Surgery in progress in NJH National Jewish Hospital, Denver est. 1899''.

mods.abstract: A heart surgery in progress at National Jewish Hospital. The cardiac surgery program was started in 1948 and discontinued in June of 1968. This program was one of the first in the West to perform the heart valve operation, mitral commissurotomy in the late 1940s. Even though the program had produced pioneering work in open-heart and lung surgery, it became too expensive to maintain and was no longer considered unique.
